p: Andrographis paniculata (family: Acanthaceae) is an important medicinal herb—used in Indian system of medicine (Ayurveda, Siddha, and Unani), traditional and folk system of medicine. The plant has been used to treat snakebite, malaria, constipation, and also as an appetizer. It has been used in the Asian continent to treat various infections and it is the sole remedy to treat malaria until the discovery of ‘quinine’ drug from Cinchona. This plant is included in Indian Pharmacopoeia and it is one of the active ingredients of about 26 Ayurvedic formulations ( Sanjutha et al., 2008; Verma et al., 2018).
